title: Options Trading Think in Windows Not Exact Dates
text: Welcome to Outlier Options Trading Tips where I teach you something in three minutes or less, let's get right to it. One of the most common mistakes new options traders make is when they're analyzing something just like Visa for an example because it's up and we want to take a position on it. We think it might continue to go up. We're not exactly sure what timeframe it might continue to go up, but as we take a look over at the options chain, we can see that there are a lot of different explorations available to us and we say, well, I think it might happen in 25 days. So a lot of novice traders do is they pick this 25 day expiration because in their idea, the trade might play out sometime over the next 25 days. What's the problem with this?
